leukapp.apps.aliquots.models module¶

Models and database schemas for the aliquots application.

See Django’s Model Documentation for more information.

class Aliquot(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: leukapp.apps.core.models.LeukappModel

Specimen's sub-collections stored in separated tubes.

APP_NAME = 'aliquots'¶

Name of the application where Aliquot is contained.

specimen¶

ForeignKey to the Specimen model.

ext_id = None¶

ID used by the Institution or Scientist to track the Aliquot.

The default value is UNKNOWN because it’s likely that scientist don’t know this ID.

dna_extractions_count = None¶

Count of DNA Extractions associated with the Aliquot.

rna_extractions_count = None¶

Count of RNA Extractions associated with the Aliquot.

int_id = None¶

Internal ID used to describe the Aliquot instance.

This value is generated by _get_int_id() and it includes crucial information (e.g. 1).

  • 1 indicates that the current Aliquot is the first tube used for the from the parent class Specimen.
slug = None¶

Aliquot's unique identifier (leukid).

The int_id is added to the Specimen.slug to generate the Aliquot’s slug.

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

exception Aliquot.MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.MultipleObjectsReturned

Aliquot.extraction_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.
